revised_title: In-Depth Analysis of Collagen Protein Structure
tldr: The authors discuss the structure of collagen proteins, analyzing their physical and chemical properties, and examining the various models proposed for their structure. They argue that none of the existing models are consistent with all the features of collagen, and propose a new model based on planar trans amide groups. This model accounts for the 2-86A meridional spacing and the 1-75 perpendicular dichroism observed in the N-H stretching frequency. The authors emphasize the need for further research on collagen proteins, including biochemical analysis and investigation of the effects of salts and large molecules on their precipitation.
